Warehouse Support Staff Job at Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited




        
    

        
        Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited is an indigenous pharmaceutical company incorporated in July 1988 as a fully capitalized limited liability company with RC no 116 088 to among other activities, engage in the wholesale of Pharmaceutical products. Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited was born out of the dire need for an alternative to the hitherto existing chaotic distribution in the pharmaceutical supply chain. with the goal of addressing the gaps in the distribution value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Support Staff

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are Pharmaceutical wholesale distributor looking for men who are passionate about the workings of a Warehouse to join in our team as Store/ warehouse staff to join our team.
	The team is responsible for receiving materials incoming from vendors, managing warehouse / store stock, replenishing shop floor stock, and maintaining accurate stock records.


Responsibilities


	Maintain and monitor the accuracy of inventory and timely replenishment.
	Ensure all documentation related to responsibility is accurately processed, distributed, and released to all concerned in a timely manner.
	Ensures all responsibilities are complied with any company policy, systems, and industry.
	Makes sure stock is arranged for easy physical count and stock-taking
	Replenish shop floor stock constantly
	Managed inbound and outbound process of product.
	Ensure the relevance and accuracy of all documentation relating to goods received and goods dispatched including labeling of all stock items
	Ensure that workings are in compliance with standards and policy
	Issues materials against authorized store requisition and keeps store.
	Report all warehouse activities on monthly for stock inventory, and pallets kept at warehouses both internal and external.
	To ensure physical stock takes correct in compared to the system and give an explanation for variances


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Diploma with at least 1year of experience in retail, pharmacy or FMCG.
	Age range: 25- 39 years old.
	Warehouse or retail store experience would be advantageous
	High level of Integrity.
	Physical strength to carry and move stock
	Good communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to pay attention to detail.
	Proximity to Surulere, Ojuelegba, and Yaba would be most preferred.
	Must live within or close to Surulere, Ojuelegba, Ajegunle, Apapa, Mushin, Fadeyi, Yaba or environ.


Salary
N80,000 - N140,000 monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Hrnemitt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Brands Optimal Limited
content:
Brands Optimal Limited is one of Africa’s leading Experiential Marketing Agency which optimizes value for client through the use of strategic, reliable and measurable method in consumer engagement, loyalty seeding and sales generation.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Payable Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Payable Officer to join our Finance team.


Responsibilities
The Payable Officer will be responsible for managing and validating all outgoing payments and financial obligations of the company, including:


	Verifying and confirming the accuracy, authenticity and completeness before all payment processing.
	Ensuring that all supporting documents (invoices, memos, approvals, vendor details, etc.) are correct and properly filed.
	Processing vendor payments, staff claims, reimbursements and other payables promptly.
	Maintaining an up-to-date record of all payables and ensuring timely settlement.
	Liaising with vendors, internal departments, and relevant stakeholders for confirmation of transactions.
	Reconciling payment records with bank statements and internal financial reports.
	Flagging discrepancies, errors or questionable transactions for further review.
	Supporting the Finance Department in audits, reporting, and administrative tasks.


Requirements and Skills


	HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance or any related field with a minimum qualification of Upper Credit or Second Class Upper Division.
	2 - 4 years of experience as a payable officer.
	Proven experience in accounts payable or a similar finance role is an added advantage.
	Strong analytical and verification skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
	Proficiency in MS Excel and basic accounting tools.
	Strong communication and documentation skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.


Salary & Benefits


	Competitive salary and benefits package
	Opportunities for career development and training
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.


Application Closing Date: 27th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@brandsoptimal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Graduate Trainee

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)
Industry: Experiential Marketing
Resumption Date: February 2026.

Job Brief


	As a graduate Trainee, you will participate in various training programs, rotations, and projects designed to expose you to different aspects of the organization and develop your professional capabilities.
	our role involves learning from experienced professionals, acquiring technical and soft skills, and contributing to the organization.
	Successful candidates will participate in a structured training program that cuts across all aspects of the business: Client Services, Operations, Creative, Procurement, Human Resources, Finance, Warehousing & Logistics.


Requirements and Qualifications


	HND qualification / Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Mass Communication, Finance, Accounting, Management, or a related field.
	At least Upper Credit or Second-Class Upper Division (2:1).
	Recently concluded NYSC or a maximum of 1-year of post-NYSC experience.
	Excellent communication and Interpersonal skills.
	Previous Internship experience with an Experiential or Advertising agency is a plus.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work collaboratively within a team.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
	Proactive attitude with a willingness to adapt to a dynamic work environment.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits.
	Access to training and career development opportunities.
	Dynamic work environment.
	A supportive and collaborative culture.


Application Closing Date: 31st January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to: jobs@brandsoptimal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Procurement Finance Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Experiential Marketing

Job Description


	We are seeking a meticulous and proactive Procurement Finance Officer to support our procurement and finance operations.


Responsibilities
The Procurement Finance Officer will ensure financial accuracy, cost efficiency and verification of all procurement-related transactions. Key duties include:


	Verifying and confirming that all prices of items requested or purchased are accurate, competitive and properly approved.
	Reviewing vendor quotations, invoices, purchase orders and supporting documents for correctness and compliance with company standards.
	Ensuring cost-saving measures are incorporated into procurement activities.
	Supporting procurement processes by validating pricing, quantities and vendor details before final approval.
	Maintaining an updated database of vendor price lists and market rates.
	Identifying price discrepancies and escalating issues for prompt resolution.
	Collaborating with the Procurement and Finance teams to ensure seamless execution of purchasing activities.
	Assisting in the reconciliation of procurement transactions and expenditure reports.
	Participating in vendor evaluation and maintaining proper procurement documentation.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration or any related field with a minimum qualification of Upper Credit or Second Class Upper Division.
	Prior experience in procurement finance, accounts or relevant operations is an added advantage.
	Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail.
	Sound understanding of pricing verification and basic procurement procedures.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic accounting tools.
	Strong communication, documentation and coordination skills.
	Ability to work with accuracy under pressure and meet deadlines.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and benefits package
